poem:
**The Unreviewable Machine**

This metal mouth, mute witness,  
swallows sums without a sigh—  
a mechanical priest absolving  
anonymous offerings.

Yet they plead for praise—  
stars for service, eulogies to gears.  
Recommend the cold convenience?  
This exchange needs no applause,  
numbers and nods enough.  
Some bridges shall remain unmarked,  
anonymity's quiet grace.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "No-star review for a request for feedback | Brief letters I am used to the constant email requests for feedback or reviews after purchasing anything online or receiving deliveries, but this one beggars belief: “Based on your recent experience of using the cash deposit machine, how likely are you to recommend the NatWest Didsbury Wilmslow Road to a friend or family member?” Do Natwest seriously think I have time to review a machine?Susan TreagusManchester •". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
